title: Cost of Meetings Calculator
description: Calculate the true financial impact of organization meetings based on participant salaries and duration.
methodSummary: Hourly Rate = Annual Salary / 2080 standard work hours.
Meeting Cost = Participants × Hourly Rate × Duration.
Cost per Decision adds a 20% overhead for context-switching and preparation time.
assumptions: Based on 2080 working hours per year (40 hours/week).
Assumes all participants are focused 100% on the meeting for its duration.
Average salary is used for anonymity and speed.
insights: A 60-minute meeting with 10 senior managers can easily cost the company over $1,500 in direct payroll.
Reducing participant count by just 2 people can save thousands of dollars annually on recurring meetings.

faqs.a: It accounts for the 'context switching' cost—the time employees spend preparing for and refocusing after a meeting.
Payroll cost is the same. However, remote meetings avoid infrastructure costs (office space, catering) and travel time.
It is a respectful way to estimate organizational cost without requiring sensitive individual payroll data.

faqs.q: How can I lower meeting costs?
faqs.a: Set clear agendas, limit participants to essential contributors, or try asynchronous communication (Email/Slack).

faqs.q: Is the cost of the room included?
faqs.a: This calculator focuses solely on the time-value of participants, which is usually the largest component of meeting costs.
The 'Cost per Decision' output adds a 20% buffer to reflect preparation and post-meeting follow-up.
